FuncDef:
The dhcp relay unnumbered table write-delay command sets an interval for storing user entries on a DHCP relay agent.
The undo dhcp relay unnumbered table write-delay command restores the default setting.
By default, the interval for storing user entries on a DHCP relay agent is 300s.
CLIs: undo dhcp relay unnumbered table write-delay [ <interval-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval for storing user entries on a DHCP relay agent.
The value is an integer ranging from 300 to 86400, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set an interval for storing user entries on a DHCP relay agent, run the dhcp relay unnumbered table write-delay command.
Prerequisites
The DHCP relay agent has been enabled to store user entries using the dhcp relay unnumbered table autosave command.
